resources.string: There are lots of foods to choose from in each food group. Use the recommendations in each food group to help guide your food choices.
My Canadian Food Guide is an interactive tool that provides valuable information for your healthy lifestyle.
This application helps you: \n - Learn how many Food Guide servings you need to eat from each of the four food groups \n - See how much food is one Food Guide serving
Select your profile or make a new one:
What are the four food groups?

Fruits and Vegetables are foods full of valuable nutrients which have a lot of health benefits including: 
 - Fruits give us plenty of fibre, vitamins, minerals including potassium, Vitamins A and C. 
 - A healthy intake of fruit and vegetables help protect against major illnesses such as cancer and heart disease. 
 - Most fruit and vegetables are low in calories and are filling. 
 - Eating a range of fruits and vegetables will provide antioxidants which will work together to protect our bodies.

Grain products give us most of the carbohydrate we need for energy to see us through our day. It helps us concentrate at school or at work and it powers us when we play sports or do exercise. Grain products contain Vitamin B, fibre and minerals such as zinc and magnesium. Grain products include items such as bread, rice and pasta.

Milk and Alternatives are an important source of calcium which help give us strong bones and teeth. They also provide protein, carbohydrates, minerals like zinc, vitamins such as A and B12, and fat (for energy). Milk products include items such as milk, yogurt and cheese.

Meat and Alternatives include a wide range of foods which give us many important nutrient such as protein, iron, zinc, vitamin B, and fats such as omega fatty acids. This food group is also known as the Protein Group. Meat products include items such as meat, poultry, seafood, eggs, tofu and other soy products.
